Package io.permazen.core.type

Class StringConvertedType<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.permazen.core.FieldType<T>
      • io.permazen.core.type.NonNullFieldType<T>
        • io.permazen.core.type.StringConvertedType<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The associated Java type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparator<T>
    public class StringConvertedType<T>
extends NonNullFieldType<T>
    FieldType for any Java type that can be encoded and ordered as a String. A Converter is used to convert between native and String forms.

    Null values are not supported by this class; instead, use StringEncodedType, which is the null-supporting wrapper around this class.

    The given Converter must be Serializable in order for an instance of this class to also be Serializable.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • toString

        public String toString​(T obj)
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Encode a non-null value as a String for later decoding by fromString().

        Each of the characters in the returned String must be one of the valid XML characters (tab, newline, carriage return, \u0020 - \ud7ff, and \ue000 - \fffdf).

        The implementation in FieldType checks that value is not null, then delegates to FieldType.toParseableString(T). Subclasses that override this method should also override fromString().

        Overrides:
        toString in class FieldType<T>
        Parameters:
        obj - actual value, never null
        Returns:
        string encoding of value acceptable to fromString()
        See Also:
        The XML 1.0 Specification

      • fromString

        public T fromString​(String string)
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Parse a non-null value previously encoded by toString(T).

        The implementation in FieldType creates a new ParseContext based on string, delegates to FieldType.toParseableString(T) to parse it, and verifies that all of string was consumed during the parse. Subclasses that override this method should also override toString(T).

        Overrides:
        fromString in class FieldType<T>
        Parameters:
        string - non-null value previously encoded as a String by toString(T)
        Returns:
        actual value

      • toParseableString

        public String toParseableString​(T obj)
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Encode a possibly null value as a String for later decoding by fromParseableString(). The string value must be self-delimiting, i.e., decodable even when followed by arbitrary additional characters, and must not start with whitespace or closing square bracket ("]").

        In addition, each of the characters in the returned String must be one of the valid XML characters (tab, newline, carriage return, \u0020 - \ud7ff, and \ue000 - \fffdf).

        Specified by:
        toParseableString in class FieldType<T>
        Parameters:
        obj - actual value (possibly null)
        Returns:
        string encoding of value acceptable to fromParseableString()
        See Also:
        The XML 1.0 Specification

      • fromParseableString

        public T fromParseableString​(ParseContext ctx)
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Parse a value previously encoded by toParseableString() as a self-delimited String and positioned at the start of the given parsing context.
        Specified by:
        fromParseableString in class FieldType<T>
        Parameters:
        ctx - parse context starting with a string previously encoded via toParseableString()
        Returns:
        actual value (possibly null)

      • compare

        public int compare​(T obj1,
                   T obj2)
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Order two field values.

        This method must provide a total ordering of all supported Java values that is consistent with the database ordering, i.e., the unsigned lexicographical ordering of the corresponding byte[] encoded field values.

        If null is a supported Java value, then the returned Comparator must accept null parameters without throwing an exception (note, this is a stronger requirement than the Comparator interface normally requires).

        Note: by convention, null values usually sort last.

        Specified by:
        compare in interface Comparator<T>
        Specified by:
        compare in class FieldType<T>

      • hasPrefix0x00

        public boolean hasPrefix0x00()
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Determine whether any of this field type's encoded values start with a 0x00 byte. Certain optimizations are possible when this is not the case. It is safe for this method to always return true.

        Note: changing the return value of this method usually means changing the binary encoding, resulting in an incompatible type.

        The implementation in FieldType returns true.

        Overrides:
        hasPrefix0x00 in class FieldType<T>
        Returns:
        true if an encoded value starting with 0x00 exists

      • hasPrefix0xff

        public boolean hasPrefix0xff()
        Description copied from class: FieldType
        Determine whether any of this field type's encoded values start with a 0xff byte. Certain optimizations are possible when this is not the case. It is safe for this method to always return true.

        Note: changing the return value of this method usually means changing the binary encoding, resulting in an incompatible type.

        The implementation in FieldType returns true.

        Overrides:
        hasPrefix0xff in class FieldType<T>
        Returns:
        true if an encoded value starting with 0xff exists
